Avery, Sr.|James Avery]]|year=|nota=Actor|ref=}} {{Alum|name=[[Misster Ray]]|year=2006 & 2017 |nota=BET [[College Hill (TV series)|College Hill]] and Vh1 [[Love & Hip Hop: Hollywood]]|ref=}} {{Alum|name=[[Deshauna Barber]]|year=2011|nota=[[Miss USA 2016]], Top 9 in [[Miss Universe 2016]]|ref=http://www.vsu.edu/news/news/2016/06/vsu-graduate-crowned-miss-usa.php}} {{Alum|name=[[Clara Byrd Baker]]|year=|nota=Educator, civic leader, and suffragette|ref={{cite web|title=African–American History Month at the Library of Virginia|url=http://www.lva.virginia.gov/public/trailblazers/2007/index.htm?bio=baker|website=lva.virginia.gov|publisher=Library of Virginia}}}} {{Alum|name=[[Aline Elizabeth Black]]|year=|nota=Educator and the focus of a civil rights suit|ref=}} {{Alum|name=[[Joe Bonner]]|year=|nota=Jazz pianist|ref={{cite web|url=http://www.allaboutjazz.com/php/musician.php?id=5167|title=Joe Bonner at All About Jazz|publisher=allaboutjazz.com|accessdate=2011-01-26|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110416064156/http://www.allaboutjazz.com/php/musician.php?id=5167|archivedate=2011-04-16|df=}}}} {{Alum|name=[[Herman Branson]]|year=1936|nota=African American physicist, best known for his research on the alpha helix protein structure|ref={{cite web|url=http://www.pnas.org/site/misc/classics1.shtml |title=The Protein Papers |publisher=pnas.org |accessdate=2011-01-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120525085152/http://www.pnas.org/site/misc/classics1.shtml |archivedate=May 25, 2012 }}}} {{Alum|name=[[Rovenia M. {{multiple image|perrow = 2|total_width=300 | image1 = Milledgeville Youth ChalleNGe Academy Grand Opening (32512920622).jpg | image2 = Youth Challenge Academy cadet throws a sandbag to Georgia State Defense Force Cpl. Richard Wilson.jpg | image3 = Youth Family Day at Ft. Youth (25742988177).jpg | image4 = Oregon National Guard Youth Challenge Program Graduation Ceremony DVIDS499755.jpg | footer = '''Top left:''' Cadet Darblin Cabral, from the Ft. Stewart Youth Challenge Academy Class 47 Honor Guard. '''Top right:''' A Youth Challenge Academy cadet throws a sandbag to [[Georgia State Defense Force]] Cpl. Richard Wilson. '''Bottom left:''' A student hugs her mother during the Georgia National Guard Youth Challenge Academy Family Day event. '''Bottom right:''' The Oregon National Guard Youth Challenge Program Cadet Color Guard team. }} The '''Youth Challenge Program''' is a program for at-risk youth run by the [[National Guard of the United States]], which consists of Youth Challenge Academies (known as YCA's) in each participating state. The stated mission of the Youth Challenge Program is "to intervene in and reclaim the lives of at-risk youth to produce program graduates with the values, skills, education and self-discipline necessary to succeed as adults." The program accepts 16- to 18-year-old male and female [[high school]] [[Dropping out|dropout]]s who are drug-free and not in trouble with the law. The program lasts for 17½ months. The first 5½ months are part of the quasi-military Residential Phase. The last 12 months are part of the Post-Residential Phase. Most participants will earn their [[GED]] or a high school diploma by the end of their Residential Phase.
The program is one of many programs administered by the [[National Guard Bureau]] that address leadership, life skills, and physical training.<ref>[http://www.partnersineducation.com/Content/Default.aspx?pid=9 National Guard Programs and Presentations] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090508084208/http://www.partnersineducation.com/Content/Default.aspx?pid=9 |date=May 8, 2009 }}</ref>
==Core Components== *[[Citizenship]] *Academic excellence ([[GED]]/high school diploma attainment) *Life-coping skills *Service to community *Health and hygiene *Job skills training *Leadership/followership *Physical training
==Participating states and territories== The following is a list of states who participate in the Youth Challenge Program. Some states have multiple campuses; for example, Georgia has a YCA at both [[Ft. Stewart]] and [[Ft. Gordon]], but both fall under the same state director. *[[Alaska]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://dmva.alaska.gov/AMYA/ |title=Alaska Military Youth Academy |author=<!--Not stated--> |date= |website=dmva.alaska.gov |publisher= |access-date=18 March 2018 |quote=}}</ref> *[[Arkansas]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.aryouthchallenge.com/ |title=Arkansas Youth Challenge |author=<!--Not stated--> |date= |website=www.aryouthchallenge.com |publisher= |access-date=18 March 2018 |quote=}}</ref> *[[California]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://sunburstyouthacademy.com/ |title=Sunburst Youth Academy |author=<!--Not stated--> |date= |website=www.sunburstyouthacademy.com |publisher= |access-date=18 March 2018 |quote=}}</ref> *[[Washington, D.C.|District of Columbia]]<ref>{{cite web *[[Indiana]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://hoosieryouthchallenge.org/ |title=Hoosier Youth ChalleNGe Academy |author=<!--Not stated--> |date= |website=hoosieryouthchallenge.org |publisher= April 2017 |website=[[LinkedIn]] |publisher= |access-date=19 March 2018 |quote=}}</ref> *[[South Carolina]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://scyouthchallenge.com/ |title=SC Youth ChalleNGe Academy |title=Mountaineer ChalleNGe Academy |author=<!--Not stated--> |date= |website=wvchallenge.org |publisher= |access-date=18 March 2018 |quote=}}</ref> *[[Wisconsin]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.challengeacademy.org/ |title=Wisconsin ChalleNGe Academy |author=<!--Not stated--> |date= |website=www.challengeacademy.org |publisher= |access-date=18 March 2018 |quote=}}</ref> *[[Wyoming]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://wycowboychallenge.org/ |title=Wyoming Cowboy Challenge Academy |author=<!--Not stated--> |date= |website=wycowboychallenge.org |publisher= |access-date=18 March 2018 |quote=}}</ref>
